metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1336 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An improper handing of overflow in the UTF-8 decoder with supplementary characters can lead to an infinite loop in the decoder causing a Denial of Service. Versions Affected: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M9 to 9.0.7, 8.5.0 to 8.5.30, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.51, and 7.0.28 to 7.0.86.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.78-1
No subscription required

libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8 - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-common - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-user - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.78-1').
tomcat8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1').
